title: Express Talk: The Sound of Impressionism
hero_caption: Pierre-Auguste Renoir. Woman at the Piano, 1875/76. Mr. and Mrs. Martin A. Ryerson Collection.
short_description: When one thinks of Impressionism, painters like Monet, Renoir, and Cassatt immediately spring to mind. Impressionist ideas of interpreting color and light spread to contemporary music as well, manifesting in works by composers such as Claude Debussy and Maurice Ravel. Spend 30 minutes with educator Nancy Chen immersed in both the sounds and sights of the Impressionist period.
description:
When one thinks of Impressionism, painters like Monet, Renoir, and Cassatt immediately spring to mind. Impressionist ideas of interpreting color and light spread to contemporary music as well, manifesting in works by composers such as Claude Debussy and Maurice Ravel. Spend 30 minutes with educator Nancy Chen immersed in both the sounds and sights of the Impressionist period.

(Please note that the artwork this page may not be featured during the gallery talk.)
